comment.author: 10771167@N00
comment._content: This appears to be Mary A Brownell, an instructor at the University of Wisconsin (1920 US Census).  She was an advocate for the adoption of archery as an organized sport for women at American universities, as evidenced by a short article she wrote for the 1920 edition of the American Physical Education Review.  In addition, she was among the charter members of the American Speech Hearing Language Association (ASHA) in 1926.
